instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Sound
threads.message:
Liquid Damage around <CHIP>U6201</CHIP>.
I cleaned and re soldering all the <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> pads. Also i replaced:
L6202
<CAPACITOR>C6220</CAPACITOR>/22/13/14
<RESISTOR>R6210</RESISTOR>


I have 5V on Pin 46
I have 3.3V on Pin 1
I have 1.5V on Pin 9

Seems the <CHIP>U6201</CHIP> could be bad, however, i'm not sure.
Also is not recognized in the OS
Any hint?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Sound
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Sound
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PP4V5_AUDIO_ANALOG</SIGNAL> = 0V

I check and replaced already:
<CHIP>U6200</CHIP>:
Pin 6 = 5V
Pin 1 = 0V
Pin 4 = 3.3 (EN)

<SIGNAL>HDA_RST_L</SIGNAL> 0V / 34K

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No Sound
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PP4V5_AUDIO_ANALOG</SIGNAL> = 0V"
Fix the problem; short on output?

"<SIGNAL>HDA_RST_L</SIGNAL> 0V / 34K"
Check it again, once you get <SIGNAL>PP4V5_AUDIO_ANALOG</SIGNAL>; if codec is still not recognized.
